channel.title: Need a working client run file
channel.description:
I downloaded the 317 deob from Oh Noes!'s making your own 317 client post, and whenever I try to run it it says this:
[code]Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute from RuneScape_317.jar[/code]
And I need to know how to fix this...[br][size=1]Posted on: September 03, 2007, 01:57:09 PM[/size][hr]Bumpage. :P

item.title: Need a working client run file
item.dc:creator: @Darth_Mopar Darth Mopar
item.description:
@Darth_Mopar wrote:

Ok, but saving it as manifest.mf didn’t work, its still a txt file only with a weird name…
[br][size=1]Posted on: September 03, 2007, 10:45:15 PM[/size][hr]Screw that, I worked it all out… Now I just need to figure what the deal is with the loading bar saying “Requesting Title Screen” which I think is normal, but then it says “Connection Error- Retrying in 5 (counts down from there)”… So now what…?

item.source: Need a working client run file

item.title: Need a working client run file
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Try saving it as manifest.mf.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 03, 2007, 09:53:01 PM[/size][hr]Oh, and you can’t just drag it onto the jar file, you gotta make a whole new jar file.
To do that, just open command prompt, set the directory to the folder where all the class files are, and type this into the command prompt:

jar cmf manifest.mf nameofjarfile.jar manifest.mf *.class

Read full topic

item.source: Need a working client run file

item.title: Need a working client run file
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Ok, a manifest is the class file you want to run when you open the jar file.(the one that contains the main method, obviously.) in this case, that file would be client.class. So all you have to do is this:

Main-Class: client

Put that in a txt file, but make sure that the first line contains the name of the main class, and press enter to go down a line and leave that line blank. So the manifest file would be two lines with the first line containing the name of the main class file, and the second line containing nothing. Just put that in your jar file, and you’re set.

However, if you still can’t connect to a server just by executing the jar file itself, run it using a batch file.

By the way, jar files are run like this with batch files:

javaw -Xmx1024m -jar nameofjarfile.jar

My computer has 1024mbs of ram. Just change that number to the amount that yours has.

Read full topic
